item.description:
Welcome to the Monday Happy Hours series!

This event is open to all, especially those who hate Mondays and especially for those who want to check out the different bar scenes in New Haven.

This week's location is: Koffee ? AfterDark

Enjoy craft beer, wine & cheese ... at a coffee shop??? That's right!  At night, Koffee turns into a casual lounge serving wine and beer (no hard alcohol) and a variety of tasty appetizers like those listed below.

So that Koffee can prepare any food ahead of time,
please answer the survey questions when you RSVP.

Vine-ripened tomato, fresh mozzarella drizzled with black truffle oil - 5.50
Homemade bagel chips & hummus - 2.75
Homemade bagel chips & tuna - 3.75
Veggies and hummus - 2.75
Roast beef, turkey, salami with swiss cheese and brie - 5.50
Cheese & cracker platter - 4.00

Items listed in blue are especially priced just for our group!


Beer and wine selections are about $6 per glass.

CRAFT BEERS
Old Rasputin Imperial Stout
Lagunita IPA
Southampton Keller Pilsner
River Horse Triple Belgian
Belhaven Scottish Ale
Schneider Weisse
Southampton Double-White

RED WINES
Bodega Goulart –
Clasico Malbec 2008
Hahn – Merlot 2009
The Manhattan Project -
Cabernet Sauvignon 2008

WHITE WINES
Anakena – Sauvignon Blanc 2010
Sean Minor - Chardonnay 2007
White Knight – Voignier 2010

If you are only a "Maybe" for Happy Hour Type Events, please put this in your RSVP Comment.

HOST: Christine will host this happy hour, she can be reached if you have trouble finding the group at 203.901.7393. 

Parking: On Whitney or Audobon with meters. There's also a parking garage a few driveways down from Koffee just before Creative Arts Workshop & Gallery Space. Yale Lot 51 on Temple Street is free after 5 PM.


Come early, come late, leave early, stay late, everyone is always welcome...

Nothing ever cancels Monday Happy Hours. Ever.

***Bring a friend***
item.how_to_find_us: Look for/call/text the event "host". We're also usually one of the largest groups at the bar on a Monday.
